thread.title: Tank Truck Overturns In Bucks County, Prompts Evacuations
thread.title_full: Tank Truck Overturns In Bucks County, Prompts Evacuations

author: CBS Philly
title: Tank Truck Overturns In Bucks County, Prompts Evacuations
text:
Tank Truck Overturns In Bucks County, Prompts Evacuations February 9, 2017 9:22 PM Filed Under: Bucks County 
WARRINGTON, Pa. (CBS) â€” A tank truck overturned on Thursday night, causing the evacuation of homes in Bucks County. 
Officials say the incident took place at Route 611 and Freedoms Way in Warrington around 8:10 p.m. According to officials, the truck was spilling on the roadway. 
Authorities say homes were evacuated in the surrounding area as residents were instructed to go to nearby Tamanend Middle School. 
Officials say that around 2,000 to 3,000 gallons of fuel spilled out of the truck and some is believed to have spilled into the sewer system. One individual was taken to Abington Hospital for treatment. 
Hazmat crews were on the scene and officials say an accident with two other vehicles is what caused the tanker to flip. 
The clean up is expected to be extensive and crews are prepared to be on the scene through the night.
